Get bounding box for spatial vector data.

Source: R/get_bbox.R
get_bbox.Rd

This function returns a terrainr_bounding_box object representing the bottom left and upper right corners of the smallest rectangle containing your data. If you only have one data point for either latitude or longitude, this function will buffer it in both directions by 1e-10 in order to return a rectangle with a real "bottom left" and "upper right".

get_bbox(data = NULL, lat = NULL, lng = NULL, na.rm = NULL)

# S3 method for sf
get_bbox(data, lat, lng, na.rm)

# S3 method for RasterLayer
get_bbox(data, lat, lng, na.rm)

get_coord_bbox(data = NULL, lat, lng, na.rm = NULL)

# S3 method for default
get_bbox(data = NULL, lat, lng, na.rm = NULL)

Arguments

data

An object of class sf (see sf::st_sf), an object of class RasterLayer (see raster::raster), a data frame containing latitude and longitude values, or NULL.
lat

If data is a data frame, the name of the column containing latitude values. If data is NULL, a vector of latitude values.
lng

If data is a data frame, the name of the column containing longitude values. If data is NULL, a vector of longitude values.
na.rm

Logical: Silently remove NA values? If NULL, the default, will warn if there are NAs. If FALSE, will raise an error on NA.

Value

A terrainr_bounding_box object.

See also

Other utilities: addbuff, calc_haversine_distance(), convert_distance(), deg_to_rad(), get_bbox_centroid(), point_from_distance(), rad_to_deg()

Examples

df <- data.frame(
  lat = c(44.05771, 44.18475),
  lng = c(-73.99212, -73.81515)
)
get_bbox(df, "lat", "lng")

#> An object of class "terrainr_bounding_box"
#> Slot "bl":
#> An object of class "terrainr_coordinate_pair"
#> Slot "lat":
#>      lat 
#> 44.05771 
#> 
#> Slot "lng":
#>       lng 
#> -73.99212 
#> 
#> 
#> Slot "tr":
#> An object of class "terrainr_coordinate_pair"
#> Slot "lat":
#>      lat 
#> 44.18475 
#> 
#> Slot "lng":
#>       lng 
#> -73.81515 
#> 
#> 
get_bbox(lat = df$lat, lng = df$lng)

#> An object of class "terrainr_bounding_box"
#> Slot "bl":
#> An object of class "terrainr_coordinate_pair"
#> Slot "lat":
#>      lat 
#> 44.05771 
#> 
#> Slot "lng":
#>       lng 
#> -73.99212 
#> 
#> 
#> Slot "tr":
#> An object of class "terrainr_coordinate_pair"
#> Slot "lat":
#>      lat 
#> 44.18475 
#> 
#> Slot "lng":
#>       lng 
#> -73.81515 
#> 
#>
